answer: Net financial debt is calculated and reported in accordance with ESMA Guideline No. 39. Components added include long-term and short-term borrowings, the current portion of long-term borrowings, other non-current financial liabilities, and other current financial liabilities. Components deducted include cash and cash equivalents, as well as other current and non-current financial assets. Regulatory guidelines (ESMA Guideline No. 39) are referenced in the methodology.
ground_truth: Sum of long-term borrowings, short-term borrowings, current portion of long-term borrowings, other non-current and current financial liabilities, minus cash and cash equivalents, minus other current and non-current financial assets; reported per ESMA Guideline no. 39 (2021-03-04), effective from 2021-05-05, and CONSOB Warning Notice no. 5/21 (2021-04-29)
